subject: Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-08 09:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/swift/swift_helper.py', 'sahara/conductor/resource.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205
(cherry picked from commit 3367d9c3632629b900b618c80261d8b6de8086ee)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205
(cherry picked from commit 3367d9c3632629b900b618c80261d8b6de8086ee)

commit_message:
Improve GET packages API call

Add 'search' and 'type' parameters

Allows to search any text occurrence in db
Support several params with 3 kinds od delimeters: space, comma and semicolon

Type allows to filter packages only by specified type

Partially-implements blueprint murano-repository-api-v2
Closes-Bug: #1304344

Change-Id: I4edef62dec2a3cf14506bede2a7482ed957c9a7e

commit_message:
Removed possibility to run job w/o Oozie

* Added a validation function which checks if cluster contains oozie
  service in its node groups
* Added unit-test covers both valid and invalid cases when cluster
  contains and doesn't oozie service in attempt of job execution
* Fixed small issue in unit tests in validation utils where pathced
  api.get_cluster function had never been unpatched.

Change-Id: I5c5de6cfb1812ff6795797df63b8ec0292395fd1
Closes-Bug: #1291649
(cherry picked from commit cd583756a0d7befccb71f82059d4b7b8e1718d12)

* Now Hadoop 2.3.0 in vanilla is able to push topology data for
  datanodes and nodemanagers

Change-Id: If5b93dde1f6aaaf619def60634da8c8819a3c75a
(cherry picked from commit 066cc7b8b43075907cd293e304aa6a0e16b3a11c)

commit_message:
Added rackawareness to Hadoop 2 in vanilla plugin

* Now Hadoop 2.3.0 in vanilla is able to push topology data for
  datanodes and nodemanagers
* Only 3-level topology (rackawareness) pushes to nodes. Why 4-level is
  not? Because this is not implemented in YARN yet (see YARN-18 and YARN-19):
  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-8468
* Even if admin configures 4-level topology configs Sahara will force
  down to 3-level.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Reshetnyak <sreshetniak@mirantis.com>

Partially implements: blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

Change-Id: If5b93dde1f6aaaf619def60634da8c8819a3c75a
(cherry picked from commit 066cc7b8b43075907cd293e304aa6a0e16b3a11c)

commit_message:
Updating the setup development environment docs for icehouse

Changes
* rewording title paragraph to be more descriptive of the document
* adding a link to devstack.org in the "... inside DevStack" section
* adding a sentence about developing on OSX to the "... inside DevStack"
section
* changing the toctree link to the OSX VM install doc to be inline
* minor grammar cleanup on section titles
* adding a header paragraph to the ui dev environ page
* rewording the "... as part of DevStack" section to be similar to dev
environ doc
* minor cleanups to ui dev environ page
* correcting sahara-dashboard location in /opt/stack

Partial-Implements: blueprint update-docs-icehouse

Change-Id: Ideed96512ee7f28280577f2520bacc620952e305
(cherry picked from commit a693dc0584851685885bdb572c1d0eb0a847a8e3)

commit_message:
Fix use of securitygroup/firewall_driver

As reported by Boon Lee, various parts of the documentation were referring
to 'security_group' instead of 'securitygroup'. Additionally, the section
was left out of one command to configure the firewall_driver.

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/networking-options-securitygroups.html

Change-Id: I148f6a96064bd6fd31f9f6abaf6985881c337aa9
Closes-Bug: 1302945

commit_message:
Remove duplicate instance_usage_audit

nova.conf parameters for ceilometer notifications are defined in both
puppet-ceilometer and puppet-nova due to change I9e10dfb2. Remove the
redundant definition from puppet-ceilometer.

Change-Id: I7f27a731b68359b22785e3807beaf94a39f185bf
Closes-Bug: #1304017

commit_message:
Add ability to configure any catalog driver

Add a catalog_driver parameter which can be used to bypass
the catalog_type parameter and offer finer control over
the catalog driver configuration in Keystone.

Closes-bug: #1301592

commit_message:
Don't restart MySQL/Corosync on package changes

For now we shoud exclude MySQL/Corosync from Patching OS feature and do
not notify their services on package changes.
If they could be a subject of updates, then address
FIXME sessions appropriately.
Note: Other resources under the Pacemaker management (neutron agents,
heat engine) are still on the TODO list to ensure their gracefull
OCF-based restarting.

Change-Id: Ia662ed2ee29ee7fc99a6e57e0040aacfc12d998e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
VMware: Fixes the instance resize problem

The fix includes separating out methods for
associating/disassociating a vsphere vm from the
openstack instance. Modifying the resize workflow
to use the above mentioned methods.

Closes-Bug: #1295381

Change-Id: I92acdd5cd00f739d504738413d3b63a2e17f2866
(cherry picked from commit 91ddf85abb8a516cfa2da346b393aa7234660f6c)

commit_message:
Do not allow HEAD images/detail

Currently, a HEAD images/detail request goes through the images/{id}
route which leads to a 500 response status.
This HEAD method should be handled separetely in order to return a
405 Method Not Allowed response and suggest GET as an allowed method.

Change-Id: Ic83e819189bcff7c4735af476217a9ed1e4f41b8
Closes-Bug: #1297358

commit_message:
Refactor the DB implementation of Capabilities API

Replace the update of DEFAULT_CAPABILITIES into the __init__ function in
the Connection class of base.py instead of the Connection class of each
DB driver.

The AVAILABLE_CAPABILITIES dict was divided into two case of MongoDB
and DB2 drivers, the common capabilities are listed in pymongo_base.py
in COMMON_AVAILABLE_CAPABILTIES, which is updated with the capabilities
dict of the two affected DB drivers using pymongo.

Change-Id: I244eabc64f985d5a7ab5e166c72bcdb88b7e3372

commit_message:
add exit trap to determine what's failing

grenade does a lot with starting and stopping processes, so if
we get a hard to diagnose fail dump the process list and disk
status.

Change-Id: Ia7377608cdc51067bc418569012df9a81d48e060

commit_message:
Add main developer page

This adds the main ('index') page for developers (to be available
at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-ironicclient/).
It has minimal information, and is a place holder so that we can
start adding documentation.

This also fixes issues with 'python setup.py build_sphinx':
- was getting "error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name"
  because sphinx 1.2b3 was being installed instead of 1.1.2
  (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ci/+bug/1259511)
- was getting "sphinx.errors.ExtensionError: Could not import
  extension oslo.sphinx (exception: No module named sphinx)"
- was complaining about missing '_theme' (oslosphinx has the theme)

Change-Id: I47ad7e10c20b80a99ae36755b2f7f67c080676fd
Partial-Bug: #1300990

commit_message:
mark vif_driver as deprecated and log warning

Several classes were dropped from nova.virt.libvirt.vif from havana ->
icehouse, leading to invalid configurations if one of these classes was
used in the libvirt_vif_driver setting in nova.conf.  The error message
produced by nova-compute in this situation is misleading.

This patch introduces stubs for all of the classes that were removed.
These stubs inherit from LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and log a deprecation
warning in __init__.

This patch also marks the vif_driver option as deprecated.

Change-Id: I6d6cb9315ce6f3b33d17756bcdc77dccda26fefe
Closed-bug: 1302796
(cherry picked from commit 9f6070e194504cc2ca2b7f2a2aabbf91c6b81897)

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I721e67c917ba7018401ad40ef30081883dcec420

commit_message:
Port to Pecan/WSME for API v2

Routing either V1 or V2 using a Facade. By default, V1 is enabled
but can be deactivated by a confflag.

Pecan controller for Lease created using WSME i/o validation

Implements blueprint: pecan-wsme

Change-Id: I9047abece78632daa13fdebfea9fb8aaa3c60981

commit_message:
Minor fixes to Sahara UI Installation Guide

 * removed item #7 - it is not needed and is misleading
 * rephrased clarification for AUTO_ASSIGNMENT_ENABLED
 * renamed 'Nova Network' to 'Nova-Network' - seems like the later is
   the only name which is used

Partial-Implements: blueprint update-docs-icehouse

commit_message:
Added CLI command to import packages

Added CLI command to import Murano packages. Example
murano-manage import-package murano-api/meta/packages/core

Also updated base packages structure.

commit_message:
Catch exception during resolving outputs

Previously we got error when try to show incorrect outputs.
Now we catch all exceptions and return None value in this case.

Change-Id: I7a7c53c1ad8f42082c89c92cbcb52599a6c7f1f8
Closes-Bug: #1273490

commit_message:
fix grub2 installation on Debian Wheezy

--target has been introduced in grub2. This patch ensure we use
the minimal version before adding the --target XXX flag.

Debian Wheezy and Precise share the same limitation regarding the
root device.

Change-Id: I5b3ad42b9fb536d13fb65d84339bc15bc23d99a3

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning in test_multiprocessing

tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing uses psutil to get a list of
processes. The Processor class now uses children() instead of
get_children(); update the test with the current call to eliminate
the deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I83a6bb72b5282d3ab2a3b8e338ee3dc8668d2d53

commit_message:
Add L2 Agent side handling for non consistent security_group settings

Add setting of the firewall_driver to NoopDriver when firewall_driver is None and
add warning if driver combination is not valid.
Modify is_valid_driver_combination to verify default settings: enable_security_group (True) and firewall_driver (None).

Change-Id: I841f9cf96ac6ee2ad17a4e8908d6c8a96f368cca
Closes-Bug: #1296957

commit_message:
Merged in murano-common

In attempt to reduce number of Murano repositories to a sane minumum Murano
community decided to merge in murano-common repo to projects dependent on it:
* murano-api
* murano-agent

We hope that we will completely get rid of this code in Juno.

Change-Id: Id203e62b040ddc2fe67399b2b487eaddca5f564f
Partially-Implements: blueprint repository-reorganization

commit_message:
Grunt task to remove unnecessary static files after compression

As we removed deletion of unnecessary files from iso build script
due to errors, many users were confused as they were trying to
change static files on a master node and there was no effect as
require.js compiles concatenates all the files into main.js. So we
decided to revive this functionality as a part of 'grunt build'

Change-Id: I227616153effcd7ded0ad6617773f46359443b4e

subject: Cardinal interpolation error
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-07 04:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.d3linechart.js'], 'message': 'Cardinal interpolation error

-Seems like for the big numbers, d3 is interpolating
 data badly and it is creating loops in the chart.
 So quick fix is to switch to linear interpolation
 as default.
-Other interpolation can be set with settings.

Change-Id: I82c1514dce6034b3cbc7f95682356a08301482b7
Fixes-bug: #1295537
(cherry picked from commit 8bcc5e9703fa4db5e702685a584d2e91fbea7b4a)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cardinal interpolation error

-Seems like for the big numbers, d3 is interpolating
 data badly and it is creating loops in the chart.
 So quick fix is to switch to linear interpolation
 as default.
-Other interpolation can be set with settings.

Change-Id: I82c1514dce6034b3cbc7f95682356a08301482b7
Fixes-bug: #1295537
(cherry picked from commit 8bcc5e9703fa4db5e702685a584d2e91fbea7b4a)

commit_message:
Fix alarm metadata in new autoscaling template

The new autoscaling template used old implicit metadata for creating
alarm: the patch fixes that by properly passing a new value to both the
alarms and the servers.

Change-Id: Ia5d99dd08cf02954ce78ef661fbe9f627948f9db

subject: Ensure network interfaces are in requested order
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-07 13:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Ensure network interfaces are in requested order

_build_network_info_model was iterating current_neutron_ports
instead of port_ids which contains ports in their correctly requested
order. Because of this the requested nic order was no longer being
perserved. This patch fixes this and also changes the order of ports
in test_build_network_info_model() so this case is tested.

Change-Id: Ia9e71364bca6cbc24ebc1c234e6a5af14f51cd62
Closes-bug: #1300325
(cherry picked from commit 721e7f939859fbfe6b0c79ef3a6d5e43c916da65)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure network interfaces are in requested order

_build_network_info_model was iterating current_neutron_ports
instead of port_ids which contains ports in their correctly requested
order. Because of this the requested nic order was no longer being
perserved. This patch fixes this and also changes the order of ports
in test_build_network_info_model() so this case is tested.

Change-Id: Ia9e71364bca6cbc24ebc1c234e6a5af14f51cd62
Closes-bug: #1300325
(cherry picked from commit 721e7f939859fbfe6b0c79ef3a6d5e43c916da65)

commit_message:
Add a custom filter method to scan wrapped dict results

Basic filtering is available via Resource._filter_fields and
Resource._children but partial filtering of fields is not supported.

This change allows a Resource to define custom sanitization methods
for individual fields. The specified method is applied after the
field has been generated.

For nested structures, particularly when elements are not Resource
types, it is easier to scan the field after generation and remove
specific elements than it is to modify the recursive descent already
implemented in to_wrapped_dict().

JobExecutions are filtered with this mechanism to set swift credential
values to empty strings and to remove the 'conf' section reported
for running Oozie actions.

Closes-Bug: #1300291
Change-Id: Ifb0b99a3e13d40306139b0d0021aead69e870205

commit_message:
Add required_parameters validator

With this validator we can validate required parameters for a given
benchmark by putting decorator like following:-
@valid.add_validator(valid.required_parameters([list of parameters])

Change-Id: I87a848d06f631da021a74b7ab3d970c3fe892115

commit_message:
Note that XML support *may* be removed.

To be more accurate, note that XML support *may* be removed as early
as the Juno release.  I think there is still more discussion needed
around concrete usage data before the removal date is finalized.

Related thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-April/031608.html

Closes-bug: #1301384
Change-Id: I0415b50ec0b81bb56f5c0fa13bc6d01f8bec7865
(cherry picked from commit 5d39189df6ecb559c3f8b7e2fa3beff25da9f452)

commit_message:
Disable check_uptodate.sh check in pep8

Running generate_sample.sh currently produces an invalid heat.conf.sample
due to bug #1288586.

This change disables the check_uptodate.sh in the tox pep8 so that the
gate-heat-pep8 job passes while we find a more appropriate solution.

Change-Id: Ib20c4f892df68f7112d969d801a18a1a5bfbd474
Related-Bug: #1288586

commit_message:
Correct update to zero numbers of health monitors

If property 'monitors' is in prop_diff and equals to None ot [],
we should not skip dissociating step for monitors.

Change-Id: I313a8e09dbeeab78126ff889316f0ecb1a9a8c84
Closes-Bug: #1301406

commit_message:
Remove __del__ usage in oslo.vmware driver

The driver uses __del__ in which may cause spurious errors.
python docs detail the caveats of using __del__.

In order to enable the calling application to be able to close
existing sessions, a new method has been added: logout.
This will be used to terminate and logout of the existing session.

Change-Id: I94482b79cc451d027cb853a6d0775e4da189cb7e

commit_message:
libvirt: pause mode is not supported by all drivers

Only KVM/Qemu drivers support the VIR_DOMAIN_START_PAUSED flag
Booting guests on other drivers with the above flag will make it fail.

Closes-Bug: 1301453
Change-Id: Ia98e018b686c4ec3c15fd1f6bcc78188f330fcef
(cherry picked from commit bfb28fcf9031af4c695177663702ce05edbbfa4d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-03 18:49:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Removes default usage of root-passwd element from HDP image generation

This patch removes the root-passwd element from the list of elements
  in the HDP image generation process.
It was determined that having root-passwd included causes some problems on
  RHEL, and is also a potential security issue.
This patch modifies the default cause, such that root-passwd is not
  included in HDP images.  In order to support local debugging of
  generated images, this patch adds a "-d" (debug) flag that can be
  enabled in order to add root-passwd to the HDP images. If not
  specified, the debugging flag defaults to false (not
  including root-passwd).
This patch updates the usage log to explain the usage of the
  -d parameter.

Change-Id: I1692916a3d7c08b8a3b180913e6fca3547a2e2bc

commit_message:
Removes default usage of root-passwd element from HDP image generation

This patch removes the root-passwd element from the list of elements
  in the HDP image generation process.
It was determined that having root-passwd included causes some problems on
  RHEL, and is also a potential security issue.
This patch modifies the default cause, such that root-passwd is not
  included in HDP images.  In order to support local debugging of
  generated images, this patch adds a "-d" (debug) flag that can be
  enabled in order to add root-passwd to the HDP images. If not
  specified, the debugging flag defaults to false (not
  including root-passwd).
This patch updates the usage log to explain the usage of the
  -d parameter.

Change-Id: I1692916a3d7c08b8a3b180913e6fca3547a2e2bc

commit_message:
Add API schema for v3 floating_ip_dns API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I6f2d99f4eb26ed578ed2c8fe3724c314002e8a05

  more common, reads:writes rate is 10(100):1)
  * Limit innodb_buffer_pool_size to 10G
  * Reduce innodb_write_io_threads
  * Use sql_low_priority_updates
  * Raise FD imits to 102400, max connections, open tables limits etc.

', 'number': 21}, {'created': '2014-02-24 17:53:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Tune mysql, galera, sqlalchemy backend settings

- Tune MySQL config settings to be more clouds-specific (reads much

  * Limit innodb_buffer_pool_size to 10G
  * If there is no mysql/wsrep config exists yet, delete ib_logfile* and
    set innodb_log_file_size as 25% of innodb_buffer_pool_size (max 2G).

', 'number': 22}, {'created': '2014-02-25 13:44:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Tune mysql, galera, sqlalchemy backend settings

- Tune MySQL config settings to be more clouds-specific (reads much
  more common, reads:writes rate is 10(100):1)
  * Limit innodb_buffer_pool_size to 10G
  * Update innodb_log_file_size as:
    * If mysql ib_logfiles do not match 25% of innodb_buffer_pool_size (max 2G),
      delete them and update innodb_log_file_size in the config appropriately;
    * Otherwise, use existing ib_logfile0 size to re-evaluate the
      innodb_buffer_pool_size config value to match its real size.
  * Reduce innodb_write_io_threads
  * Use innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=2 for HA
  * Raise FD imits to 102400, max connections, open tables limits etc.
- Tune SQLAlchemy backend settings for Openstack (QueuePool related)
- Sync some MySQL+galera class params for MySQL class as well

Closes-bug: #1274784
Implements blueprint: optimize-db-performance-at-scale

commit_message:
Tune sqlalchemy backend settings for OS on scale

- Tune SQLAlchemy backend settings for Openstack (QueuePool related)
- Evaluate sqlalchemy backend scaling parameters at osnailyfactor
- Fix deprecated in I [DEFAULT] usage for database config
- For Neutron use neutron_config[:database] as well
    * Ensure max_pool_size in [10, 30] limits (10 is config defaults)
    * Ensure max_overflow in [20, 60] limits (20 is config defaults)

Closes-bug: #1274784
Partial blueprint: optimize-db-performance-at-scale

Change-Id: I0e843022f04f53150da52858280034aad6aee987

commit_message:
Add API schema for v3 floating_ips API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I6663f49d06e3b6129656c69d78c9a5dfb47b4932

commit_message:
VMware: Fixes the instance resize problem

The fix includes separating out methods for
associating/disassociating a vsphere vm from the
openstack instance. Modifying the resize workflow
to use the above mentioned methods.

Closes-Bug: #1295381

Change-Id: I92acdd5cd00f739d504738413d3b63a2e17f2866

[{'created': '2014-04-07 15:29:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Removes the service stop call for gmetad.

This patch fixes bug 1302130.  The call to "gmetad stop" has been
  removed from the post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad script,  since
  this command will run on the host machine, rather than on the
  generated image.  Only the call the chkconfig to keep

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-07 15:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop-hdp/post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad'], 'message': 'Removes the service stop call for gmetad

  removed from the post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad script,  since
  this command will run on the host machine, rather than on the

  gmetad from starting is required to achieve the desired affect of

Fixes: bug # 1302130

Change-Id: I97a549be89212e19b84030f156ae9b175b113df4

commit_message:
Removes the service stop call for gmetad

This patch fixes bug 1302130.  The call to "gmetad stop" has been
  removed from the post-install.d/40-turn-off-gmetad script,  since
  this command will run on the host machine, rather than on the
  generated image.  Only the call the chkconfig to keep
  gmetad from starting is required to achieve the desired affect of
  keeping gmetad from starting upon image boot.

Fixes: bug # 1302130

Change-Id: I97a549be89212e19b84030f156ae9b175b113df4

commit_message:
PR plugin uses host name to query Nova inventory

Use host hypervisor_name instead of host id to query the Nova inventory
to avoid not found errors.

Change-Id: I32c3e8e71354f46ac947ecc8ee8b575e29dd23c1
Closes-Bug: #1299341

commit_message:
Provide rootwrap configuration options

Our tools now generate tables for the rootwrap.conf files. Include this
tables in the config-reference guide. The cinder-rootwrap.xml file is
not used ATM, because our cinder documentation doesn't provide a config
overview (see bug #1304172).

Revert some help strings for nova to what they are in icehouse (the
previous run of the tool accidentally picked up the juno options).

Change-Id: Id3a76cc5ae29b7cf45118958520126ec8f75853d

commit_message:
Catching no handled exception on leases deletion

Catching Conflict exception coming from NovaClient when creating
an image is not possible due to invalid vm_state.
Also, adding new test to cover the scenario being fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1299467
Change-Id: I22113ebebed74e72578fbc6baecdd8d0a462bf22

Added new manager exception 'LeaseNameAlreadyExists',
wraps db exception ClimateDBDuplicateEntry occures during lease creation

wraps db exception ClimateDBDuplicateEntry occures during lease creation

commit_message:
Duplicated lease name should return HTTP 409

Added new manager exception 'LeaseNameAlreadyExists',
wraps db exception ClimateDBDuplicateEntry occures during lease creation
and returns in the API as:
HTTP 409 The lease with name: %(name)s already exists

Current implementation returns HTTP 500 Internal server error,
which is not user friendly.

Change-Id: I3ead720eda9b08980e3ee7c5cf878354b5455877
Closes-Bug: #1302584\

commit_message:
Removes volumes redefinition in fake nova_client

Reasons:
- The redefinition of nova_client.volumes was making it,
  nova_client.volumes.volumes, if we needed to call the volume APIs
  from nova_client.
- nova_client.volumes is already defined when defining "class FakeClient".

Changes:
- Removes redefinition of nova_client.volumes.

Change-Id: I5981d461e5a0fd000214c35d5d0be58d86d6d368
Closes-Bug: #1292457

commit_message:
Add save_admin_pass property to CloudServer

This adds a save_admin_pass property to indicate whether or not the
admin_pass should be persisted in heat.  save_admin_pass is False by
default.

Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass (partial)
Change-Id: Iac59056abf2cf709ecb940b84c56d09fa3fbb7d4

commit_message:
Add admin_pass as attribute to CloudServer

This stores the admin password returned by nova() as an encrypted
property on the CloudServer to allow template authors to display them
as outputs of a stack.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass (partial)
Change-Id: Ic11f1ddcd114631b92f87d5760ab7a6761ba40e4

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Stop HTTP patch before overriding

Stops the default HTTPConnection patch used by the
Big Switch tests before patching HTTPConnection with
another substitution. This prevents mock from losing
track of the default patch which was resulting in it
not consistently being stopped by the stopall call in
cleanup.

This also corrects an incorrectly targeted mock for the
HTTP patch in one of the test files.

Closes-Bug: #1303605
Change-Id: Ia5b374c5f8d3a7905d915de4f1f8d4f3a6f0e58d

Indent code so that is readable

It was only pointed out to me that devtest_overcloud.sh performs updates. I

was only run as part of an create.

commit_message:
Fix _validate_mac_address method

The method _validate_mac_address previously used: netaddr.EUI(data)
which would convert data passed in to the correct mac_address representation.
For example if data=123 it would return: EUI('00-00-00-00-00-7B'). To fix
this issue I used netaddr.valid_mac() instead which returns a bool if a mac is
valid or not and does not raise. Note this file needs some improvements to
improve how exception handling is done that will come later.

Change-Id: I4fb868e40abbad9e743028cc768f47ca9b3e0e70
Closes-bug: 1291163

commit_message:
Fix wrong section name "security_group" in sample config files

The section name [security_group] in Sample config files of
ML2 and Big Switch plugins was wrong and it should be
[securitygroup].

Change-Id: I8204b2f37f96a5e46038e117853ac8637a9705fd
Closes-Bug: #1304105

commit_message:
pci request mark interface

PCI request identify by uuid, request_id will be saved
into the pci device object while allocation. the device
then can be identify by this uuid.

Change-Id: Ic83f2cc080aa044a1e7b828c463c6e8f62483f47
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Enhance PCI alias to support pci flavor attr

Currently PCI alias can support only vendor_id/product_id as keys,
and we need enhance it to support all potential keys from pci_flavor_attrs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-20 02:14:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'PCI allocation marking

pci request support mark the device via a caller definded
unique marker. after allocation done, caller can find which devices
is alloctioned for this request.
example:
SRIOV might use this interface, when parser --nic option(nic-flavor),
related pci passthrough requiments is translating to a request:
    nic1-request = _translate_pci_falvor_to_requests(flavor_specs,
                                       "nic1-uuid")
			               #here can be anything needed
    then update the request to system metadata:
        update_pci_reqeust(metadata, pci_request)

    after allocation done on compute node, VIF confiration can use
'nic1-uuid' to find the device allocation to nic1:
    (TODO):
       dev-list = query_device_by_reqeust(instance, nic-reqeust)

when the device became free or allocation failed, the maker infomation
will be removed.

bp:pci-extra-info

Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

Change-Id: I55cd6f411345faace26b6f416b5ba4298986303e

commit_message:
PCI: interface for populate metadata and filter

The network parser should convert the pci flavor in the --nic option
to pci request and save them into instance meta data.

The filter scheduler also should populate the request from metadata
for filter.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: I55cd6f411345faace26b6f416b5ba4298986303e

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2014-01-29 06:10:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'PCI stats group on demand

Control node has flavors which allow the administrator to package up
devices for users. flavors have a name, and matching expression that
selects available(offer by white list) devices.

PCI flavor defined by a set of (k,v), the k is the *well defined* PCI
property. not every PCI property is available to PCI flavor, only a
specific set of PCI property can used to define the PCI flavor, it's
global to cloud. these PCI property is defined via a global
configuration :

  pci_flavor_attrs = ["vendor_id", ...]

pci stats also report stats pool base on pci_flavor_attrs's attrs list.

commit_message:
PCI stats group on demand

Control node has PCI flavors which allow the administrator to package up
PCI devices for users. Flavor has a name, and matching expression that
selects available (offered by white list) devices.

PCI flavor is defined by a set of (k,v), the k is the PCI property. Not
every PCI property is available to PCI flavor, only a specific set of PCI
property can used to define the PCI flavor, it's global to cloud. These
PCI properties are defined via a global configuration :

  pci_flavor_attrs = ["vendor_id", ...]

pci stats also report stats pool base on pci_flavor_attrs's attrs list.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Iad4430a4f7461c7ac4a9fa5c76057db136831e4f

commit_message:
Raise execution failure instead of type error

On a request to schedule a unknown node type
raise a execution failure instead of a type
error to ensure that we throw a common set of
exceptions from the engine execution code. To
retain the cause of the execution failure set
the exception cause as the type error so that
this information is retained.

Breaking change: anyone catching type error will
have to switch to catching the more uniform engine
execution failure instead.

Change-Id: Ief27284512df8df549bfd84147ccc6d08f9ef728

In order for people to easily try out
the job and board concept with zookeeper (the
current default impl) it is useful to have a
simple example script that can be used to do
this as part of the taskflow core tree (but not
under the main code, but as a tool/example).

commit_message:
Add jobboard tools

- In order for people to easily try out
  the job and board concept with zookeeper (the
  current default impl) it is useful to have a
  simple example script that can be used to do
  this as part of the taskflow core tree (but not
  under the main code, but as a tool/example).
- Include a simple script to download & run zookeeper
  as well, so this process is not as hard for folks

Change-Id: I9a84c61134d92a5750b672176c61e20c98a53bcd

commit_message:
Work around the sqlite3 bug by using tempfiles

Instead of using in-memory backends with threaded
engines, since it appears sqlite does not correctly
handle or recommend multiple threads using the same
:in-memory: backend.

Closes-Bug: #1253673

Change-Id: I7a7ded414d8786f501ec705d132a4aa20e6ef1cb

commit_message:
Mess around with eventlet

Instead of keeping an active pool of greenthreads
'spinning' (greenthreads don't really spin) even
when the queue is empty spin up new greenthreads
as needed and when the queue is empty, let the
existing greenthreads exit cleanly.

Change-Id: Ifa75a35ffe678dcd93bb723e6ae572b75fc550d1

commit_message:
Add the start of a item registry

A item registry is useful to be able to easily
and centrally register tasks/flows (or other
things that have a uuid property) for others
to use (or find based on a known set of
attributes).

Change-Id: I99b96dcfef0edb826d19f71848f06e50f8457711

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 7677, 'name': 'Solly Ross', 'email': 'sross@redhat.com', 'username': 'sross'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-31 08:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'message': 'VMWare: Enable live migration with one nova compute (WIP)

Currently with VMWare VCDriver, one nova compute can manage multiple
cluster/RP, this caused cluster admin cannot do live migration between
clusters/PRs if those clusters/PRs managed by one nova compute.

The fix was trying to do the following to enable live migration with
one nova compute:
1) When live migration check if host are same, check both host and
node for the VM instance.
2) When nova scheduler select destination for live migration, the live
migration task should put (host, node) to attempted hosts.
3) Nova scheduler needs to be enhanced to support ignored_nodes.

Change-Id: I06a20dba22932d81d43b67f99817748f450d04bb
Partial-Bug: #1192192
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Enable live migration with one nova compute (WIP)

Currently with VMWare VCDriver, one nova compute can manage multiple
cluster/RP, this caused cluster admin cannot do live migration between
clusters/PRs if those clusters/PRs managed by one nova compute.

The fix was trying to do the following to enable live migration with
one nova compute:
1) When live migration check if host are same, check both host and
node for the VM instance.
2) When nova scheduler select destination for live migration, the live
migration task should put (host, node) to attempted hosts.
3) Nova scheduler needs to be enhanced to support ignored_nodes.

Change-Id: I06a20dba22932d81d43b67f99817748f450d04bb
Partial-Bug: #1192192

subject: Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'efedorova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7562, 'name': 'Dmitry Teselkin', 'email': 'dteselkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dteselkin'}, {'_account_id': 7613, 'name': 'Igor Yozhikov', 'email': 'medput@gmail.com', 'username': 'iyozhikov'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-21 14:28:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings

The idea is to specify muranodashboard.settings as
DJANGO_SETTIGNS_MODULE in apache config/ WSGI wrapper, then import
openstack_dashboard.settings from muranodashboard.settings. Thus we
touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla
openstack_dashboard settings), nor local.local_settings (which is
openstack_dashboard customization module for admins).

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be
modified (directories, different modes specified in settings) are
moved out to a separate file similar to local.local_settings. Sadly,
there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is
executed), second specifies all the rest parameters.

This commit is not a working solution for production environments,
because it should be accompanied with following changes in setup
script. Also, fixing LOGOUT_URL was dropped out because it is
distro-specific (LOGOUT_URL = '{horizon,dashboard}/auth/logout' for
{Ubuntu,CentOS}).

Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-01-21 14:31:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings

touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be

there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is

This commit is not a working solution for production environments,

Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81

DJANGO_SETTIGNS_MODULE in apache config/ WSGI wrapper, then import
openstack_dashboard.settings from muranodashboard.settings. Thus we
touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla
openstack_dashboard settings), nor local.local_settings (which is
openstack_dashboard customization module for admins).

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be
modified (directories, different modes specified in settings) are
moved out to a separate file similar to local.local_settings. Sadly,
there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is
executed), second specifies all the rest parameters.

This commit is not a working solution for production environments,
because it should be accompanied with following changes in setup
script. Also, fixing LOGOUT_URL was dropped out because it is
distro-specific (LOGOUT_URL = '{horizon,dashboard}/auth/logout' for
{Ubuntu,CentOS}).

Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81

commit_message:
Separate muranodashboard.settings from openstack_dashboard.settings

The idea is to specify muranodashboard.settings as
DJANGO_SETTIGNS_MODULE in apache config/ WSGI wrapper, then import
openstack_dashboard.settings from muranodashboard.settings. Thus we
touch neither openstack_dashboard.settings (which is vanilla
openstack_dashboard settings), nor local.local_settings (which is
openstack_dashboard customization module for admins).

Furthermore, all muranodashboard settings which are really could be
modified (directories, different modes specified in settings) are
moved out to a separate file similar to local.local_settings. Sadly,
there have to be 2 such files, because of DATABASES &
openstack_dashboard.policy issue. First specifies actual DATABASES
(before statement 'from openstack_dashboard import policy' is
executed), second specifies all the rest parameters.

All required changes in apache config are made by setup.sh script.

Closes-Bug: #1267737
Change-Id: I455efeb5ee7825ac69eba2d1a3f4aefcef3dda81

commit_message:
Introduce Hitachi Block Storage Driver

Introduce Hitachi Block Storage Driver for Hitachi VSP, HUS-VM and HUS arrays
with Fibre Channel and iSCSI.

This will support all features required in Icehouse:
* Volume Create/Delete
* Volume Attach/Detach
* Snapshot Create/Delete
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Copy Image to Volume
* Copy Volume to Image
* Clone Volume
* Extend Volume

Implements: blueprint hitachi-block-storage-driver

Change-Id: I110e4d821e30ee8b140e3c83654b039ce3ce0fc9
Signed-off-by: Seiji Aguchi <seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com>

commit_message:
Add test for keystone-manage db_version

There was no test that ran the `keystone-manage db_version`
subcommand.

Change-Id: Icc9f58e32fb6c2a629f7be47fcad6fd70bebdf51

commit_message:
PCI whitelist support pci_infomation

'pci-information' combine the whitelist and extra infomation.

Pci-information can be define multiple times like
pci_information = [{pci-regex}, {pci-extra-attrs}], where
pci-regex is a dict of { string-key: string-value } pairs,
it can only match device properties, like vendor_id, address,
product_id, etc.
Pci-extra-attrs is a dict of {string-key:string-value} pairs.
The values can be arbitrary. All the extra attrs will be store
in the pci device table's extra info field.

whitelist is deprecated.

bp:pci-extra-info
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ida2911ebe14cfb03362dbb8e06aaf35f590f2c28

commit_message:
WIP: Create metafiles for API v3 samples

Create metafiles for the API v3 samples which can be used to
help automate the generation of specification documentation for
the v3 API

Adds the infrastructure for creating the meta files plus adds
the changes for hosts extension

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

Change-Id: Ie443931ea6bb49fbf2848f2223d0e47436005c8f

commit_message:
VMware: Use server-side views to retrieve objects

Repeatedly queried inventory objects can be retrieved efficiently
using server-side views. These views are stored in the server and
are constantly refreshed. This patch adds a helper method to the
VMware driver utility.

Operations like retrieving list of VM's, list of host's managed by
a cluster can be refactored to use this helper utility, and make a
single api call to retrieve objects.

WIP: Adding tests
implements blueprint vmware-use-views

Change-Id: I65ba24a9d2254727cfd5c836a7becb0325e40b98

VMware: simple cache for storing session data

Implements a simple cache for storing objects during the length
of a session.
WIP : Adding tests

commit_message:
Add migration to fix nullable params

In some tables nullable param for column doesn't correspond to one
declared in model. This migration syncronizes nullable params in
db and in models for following tables and columns:

- pci_devices (deleted, dev_type, product_id, vendor_id)
- quota_usages (resource)

Implements blueprint db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Iaefafa9344d1ef72ac43b8495d0ebdebcdaa7e28

Change-Id: I38049574a4ff0de88d23bda5cdd9a116e4ba6544

commit_message:
Add a migration to change index in 'migrations' table.

Index 'migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx' in db is not the same
as its description in models.py.

This migration remove 'deleted' column from this index, so
'migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx' in db would corresponds
with one defined in model.

Implements bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Sync model with migrations

Some indexes were skipped in model, but are present in db, because they are creating
by migrations. This indexes are:
- ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted
- ix_reservations_user_id_deleted

To sync models with migrations we add this indexes to models.py.

Migration 216 creates this indexes on columns 'user_id' and 'deleted' for tables
'quota_usages' and 'reservations'. But 'deleted' column doesn't need to be
indexed because of low cardinality of values. So in addition we add migration
to remove column 'deleted' from indexes 'ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted' and
'ix_reservations_user_id_deleted' and change name of this indexes to
'ix_quota_usages_user_id' and 'ix_reservations_user_id'.

Implements bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I56d0e49520ea88b18d864dea0d2ce83a6d9e2bc1

commit_message:
Rename docker plugin to dockerheat

Since the name conflict with the docker library it makes impossible to
import docker library while running the test.

Closes bug: 1297122

Change-Id: Id3ee1d3a6d4e6cc6dee9a21307f501534123169e

commit_message:
Replace mumeric expression with units constants

This patch only replaces numeric expressions like 1024 * 1024 with
units constants, not all 1024.

Implements blueprint: use-common-units

commit_message:
Support expression to match PCI device property

The minimal regular expressions are rules to match PCI device properties
expressed as followed:
  * wildcard '*'  and number range like'[1-3]' is supported
  * PCI address support range like "0000:03-a5:12.1-3:"
  * OR operation must be used alone: (string1|string2)
peration
  *support compared to string, or sting compare to string

bp:pci-extra-info

Change-Id: I081dfe5a1ad392676a1e86a545ff8adf710f3541
Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Adding support for SAML federated authentication (Federation Pt3)

This API specifies the parameters needed for SAML authentication.

Co-Authored-By: Kristy Siu <kwss@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: David Chadwick <d.w.chadwick@kent.ac.uk>

commit_message:
Use mox in test_get_domain_info_with_more_return

This test is causing XML parse failures due to the existing creation
of a virDomain with an xml argument of None (I couldn't find a system
this did work on ... maybe different versions of lxml handle None
arguments to etree.fromstring differently?).

Most of all of the other tests here seem to use mox, so convert this
to fix the problem and make it more like everything else (somewhat
suggested by comments in [1]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85452/

Change-Id: Iee9d04ee0dca24675bf80f189165852283bfd444
Closes-bug: #1301602

subject: Check attributes of get server password Nova APIs
commit_message:
Check attributes of get server password Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 get server password
APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of get password V2 & V3 APIs is same and given below:

{
    "password": "%(encrypted_password)s"
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Iaec82632fd377435cdb10f8ac2e40c4fbd9f98f2

commit_message:
Move Storage Policy validation from parser to class

Currently we validate Storage Policy conflicts while parsing
swift.conf in parse_storage_policies. This let's us get away
with unnatural things in tests like patch_policies with two
policies that have the same name.

Additionally this change makes the rules a bit easier to
identify and assure coverage.

Change-Id: I6cd48e5a3b3658e106ecd20df0b04fd804c028a4
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

commit_message:
Changes Volume Prefix From mysql To datastore

changes the volume name from mysql-<uuid> to datastore-<uuid>. now
that multiple datastore types are supported, the volume name prefix
should not be hardcoded to "mysql-" so as to avoid confusion to the
user and/or cloud administrator.

Change-Id: Ib585eab42f609095dee709b6e6e5eb980eff42af
Closes-Bug: #1277401

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-11 15:25:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Before updates for volume attchments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mountpoint.

This change adds handle_update logic to VolumeAttachment,
and VolumeSwapTask to deal with first detaching old volume and then
attaching the new one. It also makes volume_id property of
VolumeAttachment to be updatable.

Partial-Bug: #1269686
Change-Id: I0aee64036bf8125f76e7f427716412a326ff5eef
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-02-20 22:50:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount.

This change adds handle_update logic to VolumeAttachment,
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume so that
new one can be immediately attached.

It also makes volume_id property of VolumeAttachment to be updatable.

Partial-Bug: #1269686
Change-Id: I0aee64036bf8125f76e7f427716412a326ff5eef
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-02-21 19:14:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount.

This change adds handle_update logic to VolumeAttachment,
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume so that
new one can be immediately attached.

commit_message:
Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount
(or attach the same volume to different mount on the same server,
or attaching the same volume to different server).

This patch makes all properties of VolumeAttachment
to be update_allowed, adds necessary handle_update logic
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume
so that new one can be immediately attached.

Closes-Bug: #1269686
Closes-Bug: #1251439
Change-Id: I0aee64036bf8125f76e7f427716412a326ff5eef

commit_message:
Ensure outputs are resolved for adopted stacks

The resolution of outputs is only performed for stacks in certain
states, so we need to add ADOPT to the valid list of actions,
as after a stack is ADOPT COMPLETE, it should be possible to resolve
the outputs in the same way as after create.

Change-Id: Iec7c9fe7cf48d7c87a5466b351ff04328d567e60
Closes-Bug: #1299173

Adding documentation option

Fixes bug 1301894

commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient v1 test

On assertEqual, the order of parameters should be (expected, observed).
But, some part of glanceclient v1 test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: If361309041a257c56bfc1fbbccf1b905839b0c18
Partially-bug: #1277104

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-26 11:29:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not share sockets cross process

If you try to use nova python client with multiprocessing.Pool
it won't work.

Reason is that all global variables automaticaly becomes shared objects
between processes. And shared instances of socket actually doesn't work properly.

The better way to "cache" sockets is to "cache" them inside Client
insntace. So if you don't share Client instances, everything will work well.

This fix is really important for such projects like Rally, that uses
python clients in multiply processes to produce load on the cloud.

Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
Closes-Bug: #1297796
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-03-26 11:42:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not share sockets cross process

If you try to use nova python client with multiprocessing.Pool
it won't work.

Reason is that all global variables automatically become shared objects
between processes. And shared instances of socket actually doesn't work properly.

The better way to "cache" sockets is to "cache" them inside Client
instance. So if you don't share Client instances, everything will work well.

This fix is really important for such projects like Rally, that uses
python clients in multiply processes to produce load on the cloud.

Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
Closes-Bug: #1297796
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-03-26 13:27:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not share sockets cross process

In some cases like in Rally project we would like to use nova python
client & multiprocessing.Pool together.

So we are not allowed to store sockets in global variable, cause global
variables are (copy pasted / partially shared) between processes.
And sockets won't work properly in such case.

In other case in project like Horizon, we would like to avoid tons of new
connections, and have global cache for storing sockets.

So to pass to both projects. We may do next things:

*) Build a class for Pool of sockets, that simplify creation of it in other projects (e.g. Horizon)
*) Add new parameter to __init__ of Client class to set pool of sockets:
if pool is not setted => create new Pool of sockets (and store it inside instance of client)
If pool is setted => use it
*) Create in Horizon global pool and create all nova Clinets instances with it

Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
Closes-Bug: #1297796
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-03-27 20:40:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not share sockets cross process

In other case in project like Horizon, we would like to avoid tons of new
connections, and have global cache for storing sockets.

So to pass to both projects. We may do next things:

*) Build a class for Pool of sockets, that simplify creation of it in other projects (e.g. Horizon)
*) Add new parameter to __init__ of Client class to set pool of sockets:
if pool is not set => create new Pool of sockets (and store it inside instance of client)
If pool is set => use it
*) Create in Horizon global pool and create all nova Clients instances with it

Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
Closes-Bug: #1297796
", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-04-02 08:23:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not share sockets cross process

In some cases like in Rally project we would like to use nova python
client & multiprocessing.Pool together.

So we are not allowed to store sockets in global variable, cause global
variables are (copy pasted / partially shared) between processes.
And sockets won't work properly in such case.

In other case in project like Horizon, we would like to avoid tons of new
connections, and have global cache for storing sockets.

So to pass to both projects. We may do next things:

*) Build a class for Pool of sockets, that simplify creation of it in other projects (e.g. Horizon)
*) Add new parameter to __init__ of Client class to set pool of sockets:
if pool is not set => create new Pool of sockets (and store it inside instance of client)
If pool is set => use it
*) Create in Horizon global pool and create all nova Clients instances with it

Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410
Closes-Bug: #1297796
", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-04-02 13:59:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix session handling in novaclient

Prior to this patch, novaclient was handling sessions in an inconsistent
manner.

Every time we created a client instance, it would use a global
connection pool, which made it difficult to use in a process that is
meant to be forked.

Obviously sessions like the ones provided by the requests library that
will automatically cause connections to be kept alive should not be
implicit. This patch moves the novaclient back to the age of a single
session-less request call by default, but also adds two more
resource-reuse friendly options that a user needs to be explicit about.

The first one is that both v1_1 and v3 clients can now be used as
context managers,. where the session will be kept open (and thus the
connection kept-alive) for the duration of the with block. This is far
more ideal for a web worker use-case as the session can be made
request-long.

The second one is the per-instance session. This is very similar to what
we had up until now, except it is not a global object so forking is
possible as long as each child instantiates it's own client. The session
once created will be kept open for the duration of the interpreter
process.

Please note: client instances are not thread safe. As can be seen from
above forking example - if you wish to use threading/multiprocessing,
you *must not* share client instances.

Related-bug: #1247056
Closes-Bug: #1297796
Co-authored-by: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410

commit_message:
Fix session handling in novaclient

Prior to this patch, novaclient was handling sessions in an inconsistent
manner.

Every time we created a client instance, it would use a global
connection pool, which made it difficult to use in a process that is
meant to be forked.

Obviously sessions like the ones provided by the requests library that
will automatically cause connections to be kept alive should not be
implicit. This patch moves the novaclient back to the age of a single
session-less request call by default, but also adds two more
resource-reuse friendly options that a user needs to be explicit about.

The first one is that both v1_1 and v3 clients can now be used as
context managers,. where the session will be kept open (and thus the
connection kept-alive) for the duration of the with block. This is far
more ideal for a web worker use-case as the session can be made
request-long.

The second one is the per-instance session. This is very similar to what
we had up until now, except it is not a global object so forking is
possible as long as each child instantiates it's own client. The session
once created will be kept open for the duration of the client object
lifetime.

Please note: client instances are not thread safe. As can be seen from
above forking example - if you wish to use threading/multiprocessing,
you *must not* share client instances.

DocImpact

Related-bug: #1247056
Closes-Bug: #1297796
Co-authored-by: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id59e48f61bb3f3c6223302355c849e1e99673410

commit_message:
Use glance as a backend for Solum LanguagePack API (GET Method)

Replace the implementation of GET method of LanguagePack API.
A GET on LanguagePack will query glance with the id provided and
retrieve LP attributes from Glance image tags.

This patch also deactivate functionnal tests for LP. They will be
enabled again when the LP API has been fully moved to "Glance".

Fixes bug 1301440

Change-Id: Ied7942da32577eca883d29b06c60a8f0da18e0d5

commit_message:
Dissociate LanguagePack and Service objects

To implements bp/store-language-packs-in-glance LP first need to be
standalone objects and not be tied to service.

This patch removes the link between a LanguagePack and its service,
making things much simpler.

It's a first start toward having LP fully into glance

Fixes bug 1301426

Change-Id: Ia7920d288a99dfda8f22a8e987d2ac53197b7e2a

commit_message:
Add glance client to solum

Glance client will be used to store LanguagePacks into glance using
tags to filter them.

Fixes bug 1301427

Change-Id: I7adc75babb4770976aa1462d45b7e1d01c64adb4

commit_message:
Allow setting the cinder iscsi-helper option

This is necessary to support iscsi helpers other than tgtadm, such
as lioadm.

Change-Id: I8a63872185f73372fcf6c90d3dde31e5bb0a168b

[{'created': '2014-03-14 10:29:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3

On Python 3, str(obj) calls obj.__str__(), not obj.__unicode__().

commit_message:
Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3

On Python 3, str(obj) calls obj.__str__(), not obj.__unicode__().

The test does not pass with nosetests, LogLevelTranslationsTest fails with an
AttributeError (self.level is missing), because nosetests doesn't play well
with test scenarios.

Change-Id: I78ae106e336480d9995ac4394197ea45b8ef9b07

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I3aed7c0b74dd64264a92f577985f8d51ebe5f96d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I3aed7c0b74dd64264a92f577985f8d51ebe5f96d

commit_message:
Missing baremetal driver API test

As a part of blueprint, this patch implements following API test -
Driver APIs -
1. Retrieve a list of drivers.

'fake' driver is created by default during ironic installation.
For this please have a look on -
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/setup.cfg#L33

part of blueprint: missing-baremetal-api-test

Change-Id: I5abe62f2fb9aec103ce4e127a28f488ef1f342df

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-28 19:01:30.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/tests/var/adopt_stack_data_empty.json', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Raise error for zero-length adopt-file

Currently we ignore an invalid zero length adopt data file, which
results in a create happening instead.  This is probably not what
the user expects, so check and raise an error if the data file is
empty.

Change-Id: I17065fe90dfce8bf2941b577255d4e1930321a8f
Closes-Bug: #1299161
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Raise error for zero-length adopt-file

Currently we ignore an invalid zero length adopt data file, which
results in a create happening instead.  This is probably not what
the user expects, so check and raise an error if the data file is
empty.

Change-Id: I17065fe90dfce8bf2941b577255d4e1930321a8f
Closes-Bug: #1299161

commit_message:
Compatibility fixes for Python 3.3

1) Added a py33 environment to tox
2) Updated tests to mock the correctly named builtins.open based on
python version
3) Other minor compatibility fixes

Tests for Python 3.3 will not pass due to this bug:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/83 among possibly others in
eventlet.

Change-Id: Ie4b512a926fa690ee77a71a89851c871ea1f6be0

commit_message:
Fix ironic api and conductor logging

The current elements for Ironic's Api and Conductor register the service with
options that override the conf files log setting. this patch removes the
bad options allowing logging to work as expected.

Change-Id: I81fb5cafbd7456e53bc3306b72bcaa675f9adffa

commit_message:
support multiple image formats and enable docker driver

this patch allows you to set the image format in config
file and then use either docker or qcow.

There are a few oustanding patches for novadocker driver
but I have it working from my fork which can be used from
https://github.com/rackerlabs/vagrant-solum-dev/tree/docker_driver

Change-Id: Ia8ad6519efa0e0c3a32a787a7ef78895110871f9

commit_message:
Adds commands for verification results

Command `rally verify list` displays list of verifications
Command `rally verify results` prints raw tests results
Command `rally verify show` prints verification results.
Command `rally verify detailed` prints verification results
with traceback of failed tests.

Blueprint tempest-verification

Change-Id: I19991219c2f184c5158fecc0d234c7a40031e092

commit_message:
Adds saver for results from `rally verify`

Better integration with tempest can be achieved by analyzing output
of testr. This patch provides parsing testr output and saves results
into database.

Blueprint tempest-verification
Closes-Bug: #1302475

Change-Id: I110bc115bd597df54499ac295d836a87411c4c80

commit_message:
Add a start method to plugin and call it after forking processes

The start method will be where any background threads will be started
in the plugin.  This will ensure that they start after forking worker
processes.

The two types of worker processes that load the plugin are API and
RPC.  Both will now call start on the plugin after forking processes.

Change-Id: I461bf7642b6f5cbda0fb1e65fe019f9f091494da
Closes-Bug: #1301035

commit_message:
Delete routers that are requested but not reported as active

There are two cases that I can think of that result in a router being
requested but not reported as active.  One is that admin_state_up has
been set to False.  In this case, the router is never removed and
continues to be operational.

The other case is if a router is changed and then deleted before the
change is processed.  In this case, it is prudent to be sure that the
router is queued for deletion.

Change-Id: I4738f599a18f0d130cc8ad4d4dafc488eec75ffd
Closes-Bug: #1215387

commit_message:
Update the keyring dependency

Keyring is now at version 3.6 so it seems like
we should be ok moving to a newer version and
removing the need to continue supporting the
older versions.

Also the existing requirement doesn't seem to
make logical sense. It doesn't seem that this
restriction '>=1.6.1,<2.0,>=2.1' should ever
match anything.

Change-Id: I711092bfab97190de635a099fb0e771a22e90197

commit_message:
Don't hard code the baremetal seed IP in seedrc

This makes it so you can use seedrc for networks other than
192.0.2.0/24 (if configured).

Change-Id: I62abfb20d097b59bbe0687aaad48f07addad611c

subject: Write network configuration into seeds config.json
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-26 16:35:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Write network configuration into seeds config.json

Updates are devtest_seed script so that the jq command to
inject information into config.json includes the latest
baremetal network info.

The existing jq command was split into a multiline string to

commit_message:
Enable Galera clustering

The current galera installation does not support clustering. This patch
contains a few fixes and enhancements to allow multiple galera nodes to
join a single cluster.

commit_message:
Delete unused 'virt_type' key from nodes list.

This key was added but not documented, and then superseded by the
pm_type parameter (for Ironic which supports heterogeneous drivers).

Remove it to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I55fb277bc2d5917083e7c14c82a3eb351993ea13

commit_message:
Add enable_tunneling to swift storage metadata

Add the enable_tunneling option to the neutron-openvswitch-agent
metadata for the swift storage template. If not preset, this option is
left blank in the openvswitch plugin configuration plugin. This causes
the service to fail to start because a blank value is not permissible
for a boolean option.

Change-Id: Ieadcdab295913121bd00dbd25e4245024bc2240f

subject: Add BlockStorage0Config Resource
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-27 15:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['block-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Add BlockStorage0Config Resource

Add a BlockStorage0Config resource in the block-storage.yaml template.
This was missing previously and was causing the behavior of having all
block storage nodes only being created after all other nodes were up in
a deployment (I presume b/c of the wait conditions).

Also, we need the BlockStorage0Config resource so that we can get the
configuration of neutron-openvswitch-agent from the metadata, previously
the values in the file were unset, causing the service to fail to start.

Change-Id: I297de24079d1ece66d35213b4ef1f2c8c50e73f0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add BlockStorage0Config Resource

Add a BlockStorage0Config resource in the block-storage.yaml template.
This was missing previously and was causing the behavior of having all
block storage nodes only being created after all other nodes were up in
a deployment (I presume b/c of the wait conditions).

Also, we need the BlockStorage0Config resource so that we can get the
configuration of neutron-openvswitch-agent from the metadata, previously
the values in the file were unset, causing the service to fail to start.

Change-Id: I297de24079d1ece66d35213b4ef1f2c8c50e73f0

commit_message:
Show maintenance mode in node list

Ironic now supports sending the maintenance value from a 'GET /nodes'
request. This updates the client to show that value from a 'nodes-list'
command.

Change-Id: I5b2efcf3def19a263fc556477396fdb309845aac

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to also run nova tests

This updates testr.conf to allow passing of the tests directory as an
environment variable (defaulting to ironic/tests/). Also updates tox.ini
to run testr once for ironic/tests and once for ironic/nova/tests/, then
combine subunit output.

test-requirements.txt is updated to pull in Nova from a tarball, as well
as mox and python-ironicclient.

Updates the existing Nova driver unit tests to account for recent
refactoring and changes in the Nova virt API.

Change-Id: Ibefa2e0d3f97512f4da9ace780703fe47467232e
Closes-bug: #1299312

subject: Show maintenance field in GET /nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-02 10:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Show maintenance field in GET /nodes

Before the maintenance field was only shown if client issued a GET on
a specific node (node-show), but this is an important attribute to have
listed in a GET /nodes (node-list), it's a good info to know which nodes
from that list are in maintenance mode or not, and the Nova Ironic Driver
also need this information to determine which nodes are available to be
exposed to Nova or not.

Change-Id: Icc31a312130a1c2d5853da64bd9091a93221363c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Show maintenance field in GET /nodes

Before the maintenance field was only shown if client issued a GET on
a specific node (node-show), but this is an important attribute to have
listed in a GET /nodes (node-list), it's a good info to know which nodes
from that list are in maintenance mode or not, and the Nova Ironic Driver
also need this information to determine which nodes are available to be
exposed to Nova or not.

Change-Id: Icc31a312130a1c2d5853da64bd9091a93221363c

object to the list. This is not correct, as the ObjectList

commit_message:
Remove PciDeviceList usage in pci manager

Pci manager keeps a PciDeviceList and even try to append
object to the list. This is not correct, as the ObjectList
is designed as immutable, although the objects in the list is
mutable. We should simply use a list to keep devices.

Closes-Bug: #1273803

Change-Id: Ie80b6f5f47a1d2d2e20aadb4779be142c17b5b38

commit_message:
Add Ubuntu 14.04 to install guide

Icehouse is in ubuntu 14.04, which is the new Long Term Support
edition, which will eventually replace 12.04.

This adds the change needed to get it to work in the packaging
section of the install guide, and updates the labels.

Change-Id: I1008ff1b578b5a09d785b8de37b4d14ea958f236

commit_message:
Prevent creation of http images with invalid URIs

Active images should always be ready to be downloaded, regardless
they're locally or remotely stored.  This patch prevents images with
invalid location URIs from being created and entering the 'active'
state with no data.  This is only for the HTTP store.

Change-Id: Iec7a0457ffb3f937a058ad7c85b01179960a6d49
Partial-Bug: #1257273

commit_message:
Corrected 'rpc_backend' in Glance installation section

I corrected the 'rpc_backend' configuration key in
/etc/glance-api.conf to use 'rabbit' and 'qpid' values from Oslo.
I also removed extraneous AMQP configuration from
/etc/glance-registry.conf.

Change-Id: Ice9848de7fdee0df82bf35082237371e1d6ed19d
Closes-Bug: #1302976

subject: Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-04 18:40:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell

The 'nova rebuild' command did not print the adminPass returned by the
server. This is because it discards the instance information returned
by the rebuild action and fetchs the information again. This would lose
the adminPass and it would not be printed for the user.

This patch reuses the instance information returned by the rebuild action
which ensures that the adminPass is printed by the shell.

Change-Id: I144bfa298bef529c78ca04042cd37a763537f09e
Closes-bug: 1302696
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-04 20:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': "Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell

The 'nova rebuild' command did not print the adminPass returned by the
server. This is because it discards the instance information returned
by the rebuild action and fetchs the information again. This would lose
the adminPass and it would not be printed for the user.

This patch reuses the instance information returned by the rebuild action
which ensures that the adminPass is printed by the shell.

Change-Id: I144bfa298bef529c78ca04042cd37a763537f09e
Closes-bug: 1302696
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Print adminPass when rebuilding from shell

The 'nova rebuild' command did not print the adminPass returned by the
server. This is because it discards the instance information returned
by the rebuild action and fetchs the information again. This would lose
the adminPass and it would not be printed for the user.

This patch reuses the instance information returned by the rebuild action
which ensures that the adminPass is printed by the shell.

Change-Id: I144bfa298bef529c78ca04042cd37a763537f09e
Closes-bug: 1302696

[{'created': '2014-02-12 18:47:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cold Migration: pass dest nodename to virt driver

Currently, the compute manager only specifies the destination
host_ip in the migration request to the virt driver. If a driver
supports multi compute-nodes, it may need to know the destination
nodename managed by the service.

This information is already available in the migration object,
but not passed on to the virt layer.

Partial-bug: #1270332

commit_message:
Cold Migration: pass dest nodename to virt driver

Currently, the compute manager only specifies the destination
host_ip in the migration request to the virt driver. If a driver
supports multi compute-nodes, it may need to know the destination
nodename managed by the service.

This information is already available in the migration object,
but not passed on to the virt layer.

Partial-bug: #1270332

Change-Id: I4204c580866c87711fb52924a051846ea85f0055

subject: Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-04 19:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma

The Keystone server would respond with a 500 error when configured
to use the LDAP identity backend and a request is made to get a
token for a user that has an ID with a comma. The response is like:

 Authorization Failed: An unexpected error prevented the server from
 fulfilling your request. {'desc': 'Bad search filter'} (HTTP 500)

This is because the user DN wasn't properly escaped in the filter
for the query to get the groups that the user is a member of.

Closes-Bug: #1302106

Change-Id: Ib4886e66af0e979fcf23a84bcd51b07034547cb9
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid LDAP filter for user ID with comma

The Keystone server would respond with a 500 error when configured
to use the LDAP identity backend and a request is made to get a
token for a user that has an ID with a comma. The response is like:

 Authorization Failed: An unexpected error prevented the server from
 fulfilling your request. {'desc': 'Bad search filter'} (HTTP 500)

This is because the user DN wasn't properly escaped in the filter
for the query to get the groups that the user is a member of.

Closes-Bug: #1302106

Change-Id: Ib4886e66af0e979fcf23a84bcd51b07034547cb9

commit_message:
Removed possibility to run job w/o Oozie

* Added a validation function which checks if cluster contains oozie
  service in its node groups
* Added unit-test covers both valid and invalid cases when cluster
  contains and doesn't oozie service in attempt of job execution
* Fixed small issue in unit tests in validation utils where pathced
  api.get_cluster function had never been unpatched.

Change-Id: I5c5de6cfb1812ff6795797df63b8ec0292395fd1
Closes-Bug: #1291649

commit_message:
Add histogram to the report of tasks' results

Add two histogram charts to the set of charts of the HTML report
produced by the 'rally task plot2html' command. The first histogram
depicts the whole task, whereas the second histogram depicts every
atomic action of the task.
For every of these two histograms, there is a drop down menu from which
the user can select the type of the histogram. The type of the histogram
is described by the method that was used to calculate the number of
bins. At the moment, there are four types and it is easy to add more.
In general, a histogram has on its X axis a continuous variable
separated in a number of bins (specific ranges) and on its Y axis the
frequency of events for every bin.
In Rally's case, the histogram has on its X axis the duration of a
benchmark scenario in seconds, separated in a number of bins, and on its
Y axis the number of iterations that fall into every defined bin.

Change-Id: Ibb8d9a7bab40a00adff25df33bac6bb0e71dfe41
Implements: blueprint cli-task-plot2html-histogram

commit_message:
Fix Jenkins translation jobs

The jobs nova-propose-translation-update and
nova-upstream-translation-update do not update from
transifex since our po files contain duplicate entries where
obsolete entries duplicate normal entries.

Remove all obsolete entries to fix the jobs.

Change-Id: I7f51922472f12f3a13feb71a6fb344076781d7e9
Closes-Bug: #1299349

commit_message:
Remove use of py3kcompat

Replace usage of py3kcompat.urlutils by six imports. py3kcompat has been
removed from oslo incubator so we should try to sync.

Change-Id: I252ff2b3a5284cee6e09e70a79b7dad550335f41
